Docs.summary: Represents a security token provider that provides security tokens for a SOAP message sender.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In most instances the UserNameSecurityTokenProvider class doesn't need to be called directly, as it is called when a client sends a SOAP message that requires a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken> security token. Specifically, a client specifies the type of security token needed using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials> class and the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials> class calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenProvider.GetToken%2A> method to get a security token. When the security token needed is a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken> security token, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenProvider.GetToken%2A> method calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.UserNameSecurityTokenProvider.GetTokenCore%2A> method.

## Remarks The GetTokenCore method is called by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials> class when a client sends a SOAP message and an <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken> security token is needed.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenProvider.GetToken%2A> method calls the GetTokenCore method.
